channel.title: Use with OS SDK API on OSSTD doc
channel.description: Recent content in Use with OS SDK API on OSSTD doc

item.title: Installation
item.description: This instruction provides all you need to get OpenStudio Standard PRM installed on your local computer for scripting with OpenStudio API. Download Ruby Download OpenStudio Connect Ruby with OpenStudio Download OpenStudio Standard You will need the following applications to ensure OpenStudio Standard is running on your project. Download Ruby Ruby 2.7. Latest stable version is 2.7.6 and it can be downloaded at: https://cache.ruby-lang.org/pub/ruby/2.7/ruby-2.7.6.tar.gz Follow the installation guide to complete the ruby installation.

item.title: Call measure via API
item.description: This instruction will give a quick overview of the API method that generates baseline model(s) from a provided openstudio model. Create stable baseline building API User data Baseline outputs Create stable baseline building API The ASHRAE 90.1-2019 PRM automation can be called in a Ruby script via its API method. The API method provides great flexibility for creating customized modeling workflow. For example: require `openstudio` require `openstudio-standard` model_path = 'C:\demo\output\\' save_path = 'C:\demo\source\\' base_model = 'test_model.

item.title: API documentation
item.description: The description of PRM API methods can be found in this API document. In addition, the PRM method is a subroutine under the package of OpenStudio Standard project. Therefore, OpenStudio Standard API methods can be accessed from the same routine. For example: require 'openstudio' require 'openstudio-standard' standard = Standard.build("90.1-PRM-2019") translator = OpenStudio::OSVersion::VersionTranslator.new model = translator.loadModel(model_path + base_model).get standard.model_remove_prm_hvac(model) standard.model_remove_prm_ems_objects(model) thermal_zones = [] model.getThermalZones.each do |zone| thermal_zones.append(zone) end end # Hot water loop hot_water_loop = standard.
